Posted By: Rikiaz (5/19/2011 10:08:18 AM)

posts.post_content:
I don't see why all the hype here honestly. Yes, it's a ridiculously overpowered card.. but it's also printed at the same time as about 5 different removals that handle it.
  
   
Let's see.. there's dismember obviously, mind control, volition reigns, go for the throat, consuming vapors, geth's verdict, steal it with an act of aggression and sac. it to a culling dias, gatekeeper of malakir, beast within, dispatch, condemn, and so on and so forth. Granted that many of them are in black.
  
   
Really, the only time this is deadly is against a full out red aggro deck that has no response to it (although said same deck can also just kill you on turn 3 before this ever gets played), and on top of all that it's 100% mono black.
  
   
Oh and that's not even including the colorless removals like brittle effigy.
  
   
Still a completely awesome card, but like how thrun was printed last set at the same time as when they printed infect and black sun zenith keeps them under control. Had thrun been printed a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Terribly designed (or developed I suppose) card. Why not just 3b? Or 6/6? Or 3b 6/6 and tack on flying? At this point, why not? If Wizards doesn't remember that they can't just make cards better than what came before to make cards impressive then this game's powercreep is going to spiral out of control and the long term health of the game will be ruined. We need the next Masques/Kamigawa block to come sooner rather than later.

Posted By: Gishra (5/17/2011 3:22:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This guy's pretty awesome.
  
It seems he's suffering what I call the "[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) syndrome."
  
Albeit, it can't actually be Bladed,
  
People are saying that control/removal will take care of him, so it's not a big deal.
  
In truth, you cannot deny how powerful he is:
  
A 5/5 for 4 cmc with Trample is pretty good already,
  
But his ability (which is wonderfully flavorful) is extremely dangerous in reality.
  
So, yes, you can exile/destroy/tap/etc. him,
  
But he's a card that needs to be done so before he gets out of hand,
  
That's what proves that he's so damn powerful.
posts.html:

That's what proves that he's so damn powerful.

posts.post_content:
The idea of splashing red for [Incite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incite) is kind of amusing. I wonder what other (and hopefully, better) options there are out there to force your opponent to damage this guy.  
edit: EggShen, you're completely right, thanks for pointing that out. [Grappling Hook](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grappling Hook) doesn't really help Obliterator. Funny how that Double Strike bonus gets flipped into a drawback of sorts.  
  
How about [Tainted Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Strike)? Suddenly the prospect of whether to block the Obliterator becomes much more complex.
